** People **

    -- To access people list
    - you are able to use below methods.
        GET/POST -> /api/people/

    -- To access person with specific id
    - you are able to use three below methods.
        GET/PUT/DELETE -> /api/people/person_id/

    -- Three fields are required for creating new person 
    {
        "fname": [
            "This field is required."
        ],
        "lname": [
            "This field is required."
        ],
        "email": [
            "This field is required."
        ]
    }

** Skill **

    -- To access skill list
    - you are able to use below method.
        GET -> /api/skills/

    -- To access a skill with specific id
    - you are able to use three below methods.
        GET/PUT/DELETE -> /api/skills/skill_id/

    -- you can just add skill through people api

    ++ JSON Example -> GET /api/skills/1/
    {
        "id": 1,
        "name": "java",
        "description": "framework for backend"
    }

** Worked-at **

** Image **

    -- To access image list
    - you are able to use below method.
        GET -> /api/images/

    -- To access a worked-at with specific id
    - you are able to use three below methods.
        GET/PUT/DELETE -> /api/worked-at/worked-at_id/

    -- you can just add image through people api
    -- if you wanna use POST method using people api you have to pass the BASE64 image to "img" key.
    -- you can convert images to base64 using this website https://base64.guru/converter/encode/image

    * Images have four types {
        1: person,
        2: article,
        3: article_tumbnail
        4: project
    }

    ++ JSON Example -> POST /api/people/
    {
        "images": [
            {
                "img":"data:image/jpeg;base64,",
                "type":"person"
            }
        ],
        "fname": "mohammad",
        "lname": "hosseini",
        "email": "mohammadhhosseini286@gmail.com",
    }

    ++ JSON Example -> GET /api/images/6/
    {
        "id": 6,
        "img": "/media/person/person_611.jpg",
        "type": "person"
    }
